content:
Sure, here is a table showing the age-based demographics for the total, rural, and urban populations of China, the United States, and India, with a totals row added:

| Age Group | Total China | Total US | Total India | Rural China | Rural US | Rural India | Urban China | Urban US | Urban India |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 0-14 | 17.95% | 22.2% | 28.5% | 21.12% | 20.0% | 25.7% | 15.29% | 23.8% | 25.7% |
| 15-59 | 70.59% | 62.5% | 63.5% | 66.31% | 62.5% | 67.6% | 76.51% | 62.5% | 67.6% |
| 60+ | 11.46% | 15.4% | 8.0% | 12.57% | 17.4% | 6.7% | 8.20% | 13.6% | 6.7% |
| Total | 100% | 100% | 100% | 100% | 100% | 100% | 100% | 100% | 100% |

Note that the data for China is based on the latest census conducted in 2020, while the data for the US is based on the 2019 American Community Survey, and the data for India is based on the 2011 Census of India. The data may have changed slightly since these surveys were conducted.

I hope this information is helpful! Let me know if you have any other questions.
